name: tajine with preserved lemon
ingredients: 1 large free-range chicken cut into pieces (or thighs)
150 g of green or pink pitted olives
About 20 cl of water or chicken broth
steps: Prepare the marinade: Chop the coriander, parsley, and the skin of the preserved lemon. Rub the chicken with olive oil, ras el hanout, turmeric, the chopped herbs, the preserved lemon, and pepper. Let it marinate.
In a pot or sauté pan, brown the chicken pieces with olive oil and butter. Remove them.
Sauté the chopped onions and garlic until softened (10 minutes). Add the crushed saffron and ras el hanout.
Add the chicken pieces, pour in the broth or water (up to halfway), and add the ginger. Cover and let simmer for 45 minutes.
Dice a preserved lemon and add it to the tajine after the 45 minutes of simmering. Cover for another 30 minutes (with the olives).
Serve hot, garnished with coriander leaves.
